name: Radical, Real "R" Quiz / Test | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What does the R stand for in Carman's song: "R.I.O.T."?
questions.explanation:
Righteous.

	R.I.O.T. stands for "Righteous Invasion of Truth". Carman is an awesome Christian singer.

questions.text: In the original French, what does the R stand for in 'R.S.V.P.'?
questions.explanation:
Répondez.

	R.S.V.P means Répondez s'il vous plait. In English it means 'please reply'. Editor Note: The correct French is 'répondez', but it has also been Anglicised to 'respondez' as the accent is removed from the 'e'.

questions.text: What color is often associated with Communism?
questions.explanation:
red.

	Communism is by definition a system of government in which everything is divided equally. It was coined by Karl Marx.

questions.text: Reno is known as the "biggest little city" in the world?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Reno is in Nevada. It is also known as "sin city".

questions.text: Which of these was the youngest on "The Cosby Show"?
questions.explanation:
Rudy.

	Rudy was played by Keisha Knight Pulliam.

questions.text: What is the capital of Iceland?
questions.explanation:
Reykjavik.

	Riyadh is the capital of Saudi Arabia. Rome is the capital of Italy. Riga is the capital of Latvia.

Rick Moranis.

	Rick Moranis' full name is Richard Allen Moranis. He was born in Canada, April 18, 1958.

questions.text: What does the Spanish word "arroz" mean in English?
questions.explanation:
rice.

	Arroz con pollo is rice with chicken.

Rice, Anne.

	Anne Rice's book "Interview With a Vampire" was made into a movie with Tom Cruise.

questions.text: Which of the following teams played in St. Louis from 1995-2015?
questions.explanation:
Rams.

	The Rams won the Superbowl XXXIV in 2000.
